citeinfo.origin: Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Institute of Ocean Sciences
citeinfo.title: Offshore Meteorological Oceanographic Buoys (Canada)

descript.abstract: Parameters: Air Pressure, Air Temperature, Wind Speed and Direction Measurement, wasves. Details :16 offshore, coastal and inshore moored buoys with on-board data loggers and telemetry via GOES. Various starting dates (earliest is 1988). CCCC_Code 2 and 12 Publication "Technical details on data processing, calibration etc. are available in ""Meteorological and Oceanographic Measurements from Canadian Weather Buoys - a Review of Sensors, Data Reduction, Transmission, Quality Control and Archival Methods"", 1996. Prepared by Axys Environmental Consulting Ltd. for Environment Canada. Copy in IOS Library Technical Records." Data are available on line at: http://www.meds-sdmm.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/meds/Databases/Wave/WAVE_e.htm

idinfo.accconst: Data distribution cost recovery charges may apply - contact custodian.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
